item.title: assigning a user as a jira admin
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Assigning a user as a jira admin

Revision History:
    2015-08-11 14:21:00 - Version 1 created by bao-bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Applies to
- HHS environment
- stage-tracker.cloud.hhs.gov
- sandbox-tracker.cloud.hhs.gov

Prerequisites
— Ticket exists in Jira for this request
- Anthony Hamilton has approved the request for the new user
​​

- log into JIRA > User Management > Groups
- filter for jura-administrators (or jira or jira-)
- Click the group name
- Click Add/Remove Users
- Next to the Add members to selected group(s) box is an icon of a group of people
- click this icon
- filter for your user and add



==================================================================
Misc notes
==================================================================

common name ====> First name
surname =====> Last name
display name ====> UID (first.last)
Email ====> you guessed it


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: CS 5398 overlay JIRA prod to stage
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: How to restart searchblox application

Revision History:
    2019-02-04 23:45:14 - Version 1 created by Bao Nguyen

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

- How I copied prod-JIRA > Stage
Disclaimer: This may not be the correct way to do it but this worked.


1) For the source server:
- get a directory dump of /appdata/atlassian
- get a database dump

2) for the target server:
- unpack the directory dump to /appdata
- import the database to RDS
- create an appropriate user.

3) Configuration files:
Edit first file: 
/appdata/atlassian/jira/conf/catalina.properties

Change the URL accordingly appropriate. If you are getting the production dump, then the current URL will be tracker.cloud.hhs.gov

Edit the second file:
/appdata/atlassian/application-data/jira/dbconfig.xml

There is a MySQL connection string in this file. Modify it accordingly so that the server can connect to the RDS with the specified user.

4) Cross your fingers and start-jira.sh





=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: flush mail queue in jira
item.description:
3Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Clearing the mail queue in jira

Revision History:
    2015-01-22 20:29:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Links:
- http://tracker.cloud.hhs.gov

Prerequisites
- You have admin access to HHS Jira
- You are connected to HHS VPN

Part 1: restarting sendmail
- log into hhs-jira-01.prod.hhs.local and su to root
- /etc/init.d/sendmail restart
- ensure that sendmail restarts and is running after the restart

Part 2: clear mail queue in the application

- Log into tracker.cloud.hhs.gov
- Click the Gear icon > System
- Scroll to the mail section
- Click Mail Queue. You will likely see emails in the Error queue
- Click the option to resend email in the mail queue
- Refresh the page and you should see the count of emails move from the Error queue to the Mail queue.
- Refresh the page again and you should see the count of emails going down.




=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: jira eazybi error wont go away
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: HHS Jira EazyBi error page

Revision History:
    2015-03-03 06:54:12 - Version 1 created by Paul Rigor

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

 If users get an  EazyBI error page similar to:

 org.jruby.rack.RackInitializationException: Permission denied - /appdata/atlassian/application-data/jira/eazybi.toml
 ....

 and continue to get it after the issue seems to be resolved.  Disable and Reenable the EazyBI plugin in Jira Administration.  The error page gets cached.


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: jira running out of disk space
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Sensu

Revision History:
    2015-04-03 14:00:00 - Version 1 created by Bao Nguyen

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

ci: sensu-02

Note:  

Application home page: http://sensuapp.org/
HHS Instance: http://sensu-02:3000

Login user/password: currently disabled
You can create a user/password by editing uchiwa.json

LDAP Integration: Not currently implemented; most likely requires a proxy for integration

Daemons:
sensu-server
sensu-api
sensu-client

Related applications required for Sensu to function:
redis
rabbitMQ
Erlang
Uchiwa

Required Ports to be open on the Sensu server:
Uchiwa: 3000 
rabbitMQ: 5372


Required ports to be open on Sensu clients:
rabbitMQ 5372

Checks
In sensu checks are created to monitor the server.

Metric
In sensu metrics are created to poll a statistic on the server. Sensu itself doesn’t store data; we will need Graphite (or similar) for aggregating and storing data.

Troubleshooting
Debug logs
Debug logs on the server are written to /var/log/sensu/sensu-server.log. Debug logs on the client are written to /var/log/sensu/sensu-client.log.

You set the LOG_LEVEL in /etc/default/sensu
Possible values are: debug, info, warn, error. By default info is written.

Common Errors
DS',\n               ^\n/etc/sensu/plugins/check-procs.rb:144: syntax error, unexpected ',', expecting kEND\n/etc/sensu/plugins/check-procs.rb:145: syntax error, unexpected ',', expecting kEND\n/etc/sensu/plugins/check-procs.rb:146: syntax error, unexpected ',', expecting kEND\n/etc/sensu/plugins/check-procs.rb:182: syntax error, unexpected ':', expecting ')

This error probably indicates that you’re not using the embedded ruby. Edit /etc/default/sensu and set embedded=true. Then restart sensu-client: /etc/init.d/sensu-client restart


{"client":"aspa-vpn.domain.local","check":{"name":"check_disk","issued":1428092497,"command":"/etc/sensu/plugins/check-disk.rb -w 85 -c 95","executed":1428092497,"duration":0.164,"output":"/opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/2.0.0/rubygems/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:53:in `require': cannot load such file -- sensu-plugin/check/cli (LoadError)\n\tfrom /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/2.0.0/rubygems/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:53:in `require'\n\tfrom /etc/sensu/plugins/check-disk.rb:29:in `<main>'\n","status":1}}}

A few possibilities for this one:
1) ensure that sensu-plugin is installed (/opt/sensu/embedded/bin/gem list | grep sensu)
2) ensure that /opt/sensu/* is owned by sensu:sensu

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: jira switch to system java
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)
=================================================

Subject: JIRA: switch to system java

Revision History:
    2020-12-31 19:41 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

1) Stop JIRA
2) ssh to JIRA
3) edit setenv.sh
This is usually in /appdata/atlassian/jira/bin

4) Replace the following line:
JAVA_HOME="/appdata/atlassian/jira/jre/"; export JAVA_HOME

With the following (or substitute path as necessary:
JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle/jre/"; export JAVA_HOME

5) save/quit
6) Start jira.
=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of
CTAC.
